TopicTitle: [0.21] Hooligan Labs - Airship, Submarines and More

Articles.Content: No more KSP!?!?

Good luck on your own games hooligan! Im sure someone will pickup your work, we had so much fun and good use of your parts and the plugins

Cheers and goodspeed, so long and thanks for the fishes

I may take a look. I doubt I will touch the code base as I know jack squat about coding but I may see about adding some models and/or textures.

I did start with just adding models to the original mod. Then I started doing some edits to the code so balloons could go into space... and here we are.

No more KSP!?!?

Always more KSP! Just not working on mods now. I'm going to stay involved though, this is too good.

Cheers and goodspeed, so long and thanks for the fishes

I respond with a surprisingly sophisticated attempt to do a double-backward somersault through a hoop while whistling the "Star Spangled Banner."

Your airborne rocking chairs will always be in my heart.
Your airships in jool - how did you get two airships in the atmosphere at once? you can't switch or save, so how?

Your airships in jool - how did you get two airships in the atmosphere at once? you can't switch or save, so how?

Use KAS Anchor to 'land' the ship
Darn, I'll be sorry to see this mod not being supported anymore as it's been one of my favourite on here.

Thanks for all your efforts, and good luck on your future projects!

This mod has too much synergy with so many other mods to be in any danger of disappearance, happily.

Use KAS Anchor to 'land' the ship

The recent KAS update kinda broke all the KAS equipped airships that come packaged.

The recent KAS update kinda broke all the KAS equipped airships that come packaged.

I know but I plan to try and keep this mod going! Of course I have to learn C but I'll do it!

This mod has too much synergy with so many other mods to be in any danger of disappearance, happily.

I hope so! I wish I could do something to help. If only I could know how to integrate it into 0.22's tech tree....

I know but I plan to try and keep this mod going! Of course I have to learn C but I'll do it!

It's C#, not C. Much easier. If you know Java, you're most of the way there.

It's C#, not C. Much easier. If you know Java, you're most of the way there.

True. Thankfully I have a friend that can help me learn some C#, and I already know a bit of Lua if that helps, and sirkut has offered to help me out as well so if I get the all clear from Hooligan then I intend to start working to bring this to 0.22

I intend to start working to bring this to 0.22

Amen to that, sir! Good luck on your project!

Amen to that, sir! Good luck on your project!

Thank you much! I hope I can do it the justice it deserves!

Thank you much! I hope I can do it the justice it deserves!

Rooting for ya! I don't have time to re-learn any programming code due to work =( If I did, I would poke around some of the older mods that were abandoned.

Alright! So if I am going to be keeping this mod going I want to get some opinions! Where do you feel the various airship envelopes belong? I have already decided that the dodec will be joining that very first science you unlock and the Sirrus will be near the end.

The parachute ones can be under survivability! The larger Duna one could be under Space Exploration,

Cirrus (Big huge things) can be at Adv Science Tech.

The huge can like ones (that you used in your heavy lifter airship) could be split between Adv Exploration and Field Science?

The little octagon thing at science tech?

Edited October 18, 2013 by Jivaii
Split the two parachute ones up?

The parachute ones can be under survivability! The larger Duna one could be under Space Exploration,

Cirrus (Big huge things) can be at Adv Science Tech.

The huge can like ones (that you used in your heavy lifter airship) could be split between Adv Exploration and Field Science?

The little octagon thing at science tech?

Ok i'll need a picture or chart of the full tree so I can plan this out. I only JUST unlocked the ability to research the node with the 'skipper' engine in it.

I can't believe there's still pages of new stuff on this thread even after I've left! Ask any questions and I'll try to help. I'm still working in Unity and doing control systems and stuff.

The recent KAS update kinda broke all the KAS equipped airships that come packaged.

I thought I fixed that in one of my later updates. Or did they change everything again?

I know but I plan to try and keep this mod going! Of course I have to learn C but I'll do it!

JS, you have my full permission to give this a go... As does everyone else, as stated in the license. You can do everything but blame me when things go wrong.

I think you'll need to upload the mods to your own page on the Kerbal Space Port. Can't wait to see what your flag looks like!

It's C#, not C. Much easier. If you know Java, you're most of the way there.

C# is the easiest language I've ever programmed in. It's a great place to start. Also, Unity has a lot of physics built in, so you don't have to worry about coding things like force or acceleration very differently.

I hope so! I wish I could do something to help. If only I could know how to integrate it into 0.22's tech tree....

I don't even know what the whole tech tree looks like yet. I kinda went about it a wonky way and now have to get to the moon to get any more science. I'm stuck with the gel!

The parachute ones can be under survivability! The larger Duna one could be under Space Exploration,

Cirrus (Big huge things) can be at Adv Science Tech.

The huge can like ones (that you used in your heavy lifter airship) could be split between Adv Exploration and Field Science?

The little octagon thing at science tech?

A basic envelope, like the original one that looks like a normal blimp, could be as early as basic flight control. It should be modified so it does pop at higher altitudes, though.

The parachute types are somewhat possible with currently available technology. The Cirrus and such would be at the extreme edge of possible technology - up there with SCRAM jet engines. Same idea of very thin materials being able to handle extreme pressures.

The SQUID - is there a "weird science" tech?

I can't believe there's still pages of new stuff on this thread even after I've left! Ask any questions and I'll try to help. I'm still working in Unity and doing control systems and stuff.

JS, you have my full permission to give this a go... As does everyone else, as stated in the license. You can do everything but blame me when things go wrong.

I think you'll need to upload the mods to your own page on the Kerbal Space Port. Can't wait to see what your flag looks like!

A basic envelope, like the original one that looks like a normal blimp, could be as early as basic flight control. It should be modified so it does pop at higher altitudes, though.

The parachute types are somewhat possible with currently available technology. The Cirrus and such would be at the extreme edge of possible technology - up there with SCRAM jet engines. Same idea of very thin materials being able to handle extreme pressures.

The SQUID - is there a "weird science" tech?

I'm still looking for a full image of the tech tree but i was thinking of starting people off with the dodec as it's the smallest and lightest (as far as lifting power goes) of them all. Would be suitable for something like a weather balloon!

Thanks for giving your blessing for me to keep this awesome mod going! I look forward to testing myself and seeing what I can do
So many posts in the time it took me to drive to work.

Thank you tons!
Not a problem. Just took a while to post due to driving to work.

Well here is my idea. I'm thinking I'll add the Dodec in with the Flight Control or Basic Rocketry. The Cirrus will go in the Heavy Aero section.
I was thinking a smaller balloon model would be nice addition as an intro science part.
